DOC.brief_summary: A new software product takes two chest radiographs, aligns them, and then subtracts one image from the other. The resulting image represents an image showing any differences between them. The study is to determine whether radiologists using this new software perform better with it than when they do not use it.
DOC.brief_title: Reader Study of DeltaViewâ„¢ Chest Radiograph Software
DOC.criteria: For Radiologists: American Board of Radiology Certification and live within the Baltimore, MDWashington, DC Metropolitan areas For chest radiographs, evidence of the presence or absence of lung nodule confirmed by expert panel; adequate image quality Radiologists who assisted by providing cases for review For chest radiographs: poor image quality
DOC.keyword: lung neoplasm nodule image processing computer-assisted
